did.repository: Swarthmore College, Friends Historical Library Swarthmore, Pennsylvania 19081-1399 U.S.A.

bioghist.p: Friends Housing, Inc., was formed as an independent non-profit corporation in 1966 in response to a petition signed by 100 residents of the Mantua neighborhood in Philadelphia and the concern of the Philadelphia Yearly Meeting, Social Concerns Committee. The Corporation was primarily involved in fund-raising for the rehabilitation of vacant and vandalized properties for low income families. David S. Richie, a Quaker who organized the Weekend Workcamp program of Philadelphia Yearly Meeting, served as president of the board of directors. The Board included representatives from the community and members of the Mantua Belmont Joint Committee of Philadelphia Yearly Meeting.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of David Richie. Materials include minutes and announcements of Friends Housing, Inc. from 1966 to 1982; financial records, including an account book, Federal Housing Administration rent subsidy applications and reports, and financial statements; and correspondence regarding donations and loans from individuals and local Meetings. The collection also includes papers from Richie's participation in the Mantua Friends Intervisitation Committee, including newsletters, correspondence, and handwritten notes on Richie's visits to various Meetings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Friends Historical Library, Swarthmore College: Friends Housing records (RG4/030) and David S. Richie correspondence (SC/198); Haverford College: David S. Richie personal papers.
